alert.note: Alert for Cook; DuPage (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 5:26PM CDT until July 01 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following areas, central Cook and northern DuPage counties. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 524 PM CDT, doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chicago, Wheaton, Oak Park, Elmhurst, Lombard, Carol Stream, Hanover Park, Addison, Glendale Heights, Austin, Irving Park, Glen Ellyn, Melrose Park, Maywood, Franklin Park, Norridge, Dunning, Belmont Cragin, Portage Park and Humboldt Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
